parameters.name: base_currency
parameters.description:
The base currency is the currency against which exchange rates are typically quoted.
      It serves as the reference point for determining the value of other currencies in a currency pair.
      (e.g. BTC in BTCBRL)

parameters.name: quote_currency
parameters.description:
The quote currency is the second currency in a currency pair.
      It represents the value of one unit of the base currency in terms of the quote currency.
      (e.g. BRL in BTCBRL)

parameters.name: Based on quantity or amount
parameters.description: expand for details

post.description:
Create an order with the specified characteristics
Required API Key permissions: ```trade```
Rate Limit: This endpoint has the limit of ```30 requests``` per ```2 seconds```. An order, after created can be presented in the following states:
State Description
ACTIVE The order is in the matching queue, waiting for deal
PARTIALLY_FILLED A part of the order has been filled and it is in the matching queue, waiting for deal
FILLED The order is already traded and not in the matching queue anymore
PARTIALLY_CANCELED The order is not in the matching queue anymore The order was partially traded, but the remaining was canceled
CANCELED The order is not in the matching queue anymore and is completely canceled There is no trade associated with this order

For cryptocurrency withdrawals, we highly recommend adding your withdrawal address to our whitelist for a seamless and automated withdrawal process. While not mandatory, not having your address whitelisted requires you to undergo a verification process via email, including a proof of life for each withdrawal. This step ensures enhanced security for your funds but may delay your transactions.
To add your address to the whitelist, please open a support ticket here.

Required API Key permissions: ```withdraw```

info.title: Foxbit REST API
info.description:
Foxbit API Support: Help Center.

Exchange Plataform Status Information: Status Page.

tags.name: Introduction
tags.description:
Welcome to the official Foxbit's trader and developer documentation! Here, you'll find everything you need to know to integrate and utilize our services effectively. Whether you're a seasoned trader or just starting out, our comprehensive documentation provides clear guidance on how to make the most out of our API. ### Features - Robust Functionality: Explore the wide range of functionalities our API offers, including fetching real-time market data, placing orders, managing accounts, and much more. - Detailed Guides: Step-by-step guides and tutorials help you get started quickly and navigate complex features effortlessly. - Comprehensive Reference: Dive deep into our API endpoints, parameters, and response structures with our detailed reference documentation. We also have a full API usage examples repository demonstrating how to integrate and utilize our API in various programming languages: - .NET - Go - Java - JavaScript - TypeScript - PHP - Python - Ruby ### Start Exploring Ready to get started? Dive into our documentation and unleash the full potential of our Exchange API.
Whether you're building trading automations, conducting research, or developing innovative solutions, our API provides the tools you need to succeed.

Happy coding!

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
Before being able to sign any requests, you must create an API key via the [Foxbit platform](https://app.foxbit.com.br/profile/api-key). After creating a key, you need to write down 2 pieces of information, Key and Secret. The Key and Secret are generated and provided by Foxbit. Please note that the secret key cannot be recovered once lost. If you lost this information, please create a new API key.

Creating a Request

All private REST requests must contain the following headers: X-FB-ACCESS-KEY The API key as a string.
X-FB-ACCESS-TIMESTAMP A timestamp for your request, generated with ```Date.now()```.
X-FB-ACCESS-SIGNATURE The hex-encoded signature. See details below.

Generating the hex-encoded signature

Use ```API Secret``` to encrypt the prehash string with sha256 HMAC. The request body is a JSON string and needs to match the parameters passed to the API.

Example using JavaScript

tags.name: Rate Limit
tags.description:
Our rate limit allow a maximum requests (limit) in a time window (ttl).
For public endpoints, we use your IP address as a key. But for private endpoint's, your SN is used as an indentifier. If an endpoint does not have rate limit information in its documentation, then it will be using our global rate limit values:
Limit Ttl Block duration
300 req 10 sec. 10 sec.
Endpoints with a specific rate limit (described in their documentation) will override this values.

tags.name: Errors
tags.description:
If there is an error in the execution of the request or response, the payload will have the following format. ```js { "error": { "message": "Invalid symbol.", "code": 4004, "details": [ "The market or asset symbol is invalid or was not found.", ] } } ```

Some Common Examples

Code Message Description
400 Bad request. An unknown error occurred while processing request parameters.
429 Too many requests. Request limit exceeded. Try again later.
404 Resource not found. A resource was not found while processing the request.
500 Internal server error. An unknown error occured while processing the request.
2001 Authentication error. Error authenticating request.
2002 Invalid signature. The signature for this request is not valid.
2003 Invalid access key. Access key missing, invalid or not found.
2004 Invalid timestamp. Invalid or missing timestamp.
2005 IP not allowed. The IP address {IP_ADDR} isn't on the trusted list for this API key.
3001 Permission denied. Permission denied for this request.
3002 KYC required. A greater level of KYC verification is required to proceed with this request.
3003 Member disabled. This member is disabled. Please get in touch with our support for more information.
4001 Validation error. A validation error occurred.
4002 Insufficient funds. Insufficient funds to proceed with this request.
4003 Quantity below the minimum allowed. Quantity below the minimum allowed to proceed with this request.
4004 Invalid symbol. The market or asset symbol is invalid or was not found.
4005 Invalid idempotent. Characters allowed are "a-z", "0-9", "_" or "-", and 36 at max. We recommend UUID v4 in lowercase.
4007 Locked error. There was an error in your allocated balance, please contact us.
4008 Cannot submit order. The order cannot be created.
4009 Invalid level. The sub-member does not have the required level to create the transaction.
4011 Too many open orders. You have reached the limit of open orders per market/side.
4012 Too many simultaneous account operations. We are currently unable to process your balance change due to simultaneous operations on your account. Please retry shortly.
5001 Service unavailable. The requested resource is currently unavailable. Try again later.
5002 Service under maintenance. The requested resource is currently under maintenace. Try again later.
5003 Market under maintenance. The market is under maintenace. Try again later.
5004 Market is not deep enough. The market is not deep enough to complete your request.
5005 Price out of range from market. The order price is out of range from market to complete your request.
5006 Significant price deviation detected, exceeding acceptable limits. The order price is exceeding acceptable limits from market to complete your request.

tags.name: Idempotent Requests
tags.description:
The API supports idempotency for safely retrying requests without accidentally performing the same operation twice. This is useful when an API call is disrupted in transit and you do not receive a response. For example, if a request to create an order does not respond due to a network connection error, you can retry the request with the same idempotency key to guarantee that no more than one order is created.

To perform an idempotent request, provide an additional `X-Idempotent: <key>` header to the request.

Foxbit's idempotency works by saving the resulting status code and body of the first request made for any given idempotency key, regardless of whether it succeeded or failed. Subsequent requests with the same key return the same result, including 500 errors.

An idempotency key is a unique value generated by the client which the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. How you create unique keys is up to you, but we suggest using V4 UUIDs, or another random string with enough entropy to avoid collisions. Idempotency keys can be up to 36 characters long.

Keys are eligible to be removed from the system automatically after they're at least 72 hours old, and a new request is generated if a key is reused after the original has been pruned.

Results are only saved if an API endpoint started executing.

In case of concurrent request, only one of them will be process, the other request will return status code 409 and an error, the second request does not get saved by the idempotency.

All POST requests accept idempotency keys. Sending idempotency keys in GET, PUT or DELETE requests has no effect and should be avoided, as these requests are idempotent by definition.

tags.name: Tutorials
tags.description:
## How to manage a local copy of the order book

### Follow the steps below in sequential order

1. Open a websocket stream to receive order book updates. When the connection opened, the returned data must be buffered. See [documentation](https://docs.foxbit.com.br/ws/v2/#operation-subscribe-SubscribeLevel2).
  The first numeric item (so called ```ID```) in each update refers to an incremental number that represents the current state of the order book.
2. Get a snapshot of the order book from our REST API. See [documentation](#tag/Market-Data/operation/MarketsController_findOrderbook).
  The property ```sequence_id``` returned refers to an incremental number that represents the current state of the order book.
3. Update your local copy of the order book each time the ```ID``` of an order book update is strictly equals to ```sequence_id + 1```.

### Important

- While listening to the stream, events can only be processed if their ```ID``` remains sequential.
  If you find a gap between IDs, you need to restart the process from the beginning.
- The data at each event contains the most recent quantity for a price level. If this quantity is zero, please, remove the price level.

tags.name: Market Data
tags.description:
This module provides access to information about available cryptocurrency markets, including trading pairs, price data, volume
and other relevant market statistics.

tags.name: Banks
tags.description:
The Banks module facilitates interactions with external financial institutions or payment processors for handling fiat currency
deposits, withdrawals and other banking-related operations.

tags.name: System
tags.description: This module provides server information, ensuring optimal performance and reliability of the exchange platform.

tags.name: Member Info
tags.description: This module enables retrieval and management of user information, such as profile details, account level and status.

tags.name: Trading
tags.description:
The Trading module facilitates the execution and management of cryptocurrency trades. Are included operations for market orders, limit orders
and other trading-related functionalities.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: This module provides access to user account functionalities, including balances, transaction history, and account settings.

tags.name: Deposit
tags.description:
The Deposit module handles the process of depositing cryptocurrencies or fiat currencies into user accounts,
including generating deposit addresses and tracking deposit transactions.

tags.name: Withdrawal
tags.description:
The Withdrawal module manages the withdrawal of funds from user accounts, allowing users to transfer cryptocurrencies or fiat currencies
 to external wallets or bank accounts.

tags.name: Transactional Limits
tags.description: This module defines and enforces transactional limits for deposits and withdrawals, helping to manage risk and compliance.

tags.name: OTC
tags.description:
This module facilitates Over-The-Counter (OTC) cryptocurrency transactions by providing a secure and efficient way to execute large cryptocurrency trades.
With endpoints for history, market data, trade requests and execution, we ensure minimal market impact and enhanced privacy.

maker.description: The fee for the maker orders

taker.description: The fee for the taker orders

data.description: The trading fees for all markets

enabled.description: Value to check if new deposit address can be generated
Value to check if that currency is available for withdraw

Indicates if the network is active for withdraws

fee.description:
This value represents the estimated fee for performing a withdrawal.
    Please note that this fee is an estimate based on current network conditions and may be updated frequently to reflect
    changes in market conditions. We recommend checking the final fee at the time of the transaction to obtain the most accurate information.

code.description: The network code. It will be used to create deposits and withdraws

withdraw_info.description: Information about withdraws in the network

price_precision.description: Precision of bid in the market

sequence_id.description: Incremental number that represents the current state of the order book

timestamp.description: Timestamp in miliseconds associated to the sequence_id

bids.description: Array of bids where each item is an array composed of price and quantity

asks.description: Array of asks where each item is an array composed of price and quantity

high.description: The highest price reached by the asset over the past 24 hours

low.description: The lowest price reached by the asset over the past 24 hours

bid.description: Information about the best bid price and volume

rolling_24h.description: Data on the asset's price and volume changes over the past 24 hours

remark.example: A remarkable note for the order.

quantity.description:
The quantity of the base currency you want to buy or sell, expressed in string format.
It needs to be a decimal with a maxinum of 16 decimal places

price.description:
The price intended to buy or sell, expressed in the quote currency
and string formatted. It needs to be a decimal with a maxinum of 16 decimal places

post_only.description:
When true your order will not be executed immediately in the market.
It will exist as a maker order on the order book. Maker orders add liquidity to the market.

time_in_force.description:
TimeInForce (TIF) is a concept used in financial order execution systems to specify how long an order must remain active before being executed or canceled. You can currently use:
Good 'til Cancelled (GTC): is an order validity instruction that indicates that the order will remain active in the market until it is fully executed or canceled manually by the trader;
Fill or Kill (FOK): is a type of financial order that must be completely executed immediately or it will not be executed at all;
Immediate or Cancel (IOC): is a type of financial order states that if any part of the order is not executed immediately, it must be canceled.

and string formatted. It needs to be a decimal with a maxinum of 16 decimal places

time_in_force.description:
TimeInForce (TIF) is a concept used in financial order execution systems to specify how long an order must remain active before being executed or canceled. You can currently use:
Good 'til Cancelled (GTC): is an order validity instruction that indicates that the order will remain active in the market until it is fully executed or canceled manually by the trader;
Fill or Kill (FOK): is a type of financial order that must be completely executed immediately or it will not be executed at all;
Immediate or Cancel (IOC): is a type of financial order states that if any part of the order is not executed immediately, it must be canceled.

stop_price.description:
Price to trigger an stop order, expressed in the quote currency
and string formatted. It needs to be a decimal with a maxinum of 16 decimal places

amount.description:
The amount intended to buy or sell, expressed in the quote currency and string formatted. Use this field with orders of type INSTANT.
It needs to be a decimal with a maxinum of 16 decimal places

mode.description:
Mode of the order cancel/replace.
- `ALLOW_FAILURE`: In this mode, the cancellation and creation of orders are executed independently. This mode ensures that both operations are attempted without one being dependent on the success of the other.

details: The market or asset symbol is invalid or not found.

client_order_id.description: Client-provided numeric identifier of the order

market_symbol.description: The market where the order was placed

side.description: The order book side where the order was placed

price.description: The limit price, when it is a limit order

price_avg.description: The average traded price of the order

quantity.description: The quantity intended to execute in this order

quantity_executed.description: The current quantity executed of this order

instant_amount.description: The amount intended to execute in this order (for INSTANT orders)

instant_amount_executed.description: The current amount executed of this order (for INSTANT orders)

created_at.description: The creation date of this order in ISO-8601 UTC

trades_count.description: The current number of trades executed with this order

funds_received.description: The funds received by order executed

fee_paid.description: The fee paid by order executed

post_only.description: Flag to define adding liquidity to the market, and never match with orders already on the book.

time_in_force.description:
TimeInForce (TIF) is a concept used in financial
      order execution systems to specify how long an order must remain active before being executed or canceled.

cancellation_reason.description:
Reason from cancellation state
Code Description
NULL Order state is not CANCEL
1 Requested by user
100 Applied by Exchange
101 Applied before failure trade
102 Order Instant with insufficient volume remaining after filled or not matched
103 Order StopMarket with insufficient volume remaining after filled
104 Order matched with counter order from the same member
105 Member without document number on Exchange
200 Limit order with TimeInForce ImmediateorCancel (IOC) doesn't matched
201 Limit order with TimeInForce FillOrKill (FOK) found no trading volume
202 Order PostOnly matched
203 Order Limit or Market with insufficient volume remaining after filled
204 Order Limit price out of range from Market
205 Significant price deviation detected, exceeding acceptable limits during execution. The remaining volume has been canceled due to a breached price limit.

TimeInForce (TIF) is a concept used in financial

Reason from cancellation state
Code Description
NULL Order state is not CANCEL
1 Requested by user
100 Applied by Exchange
101 Applied before failure trade
102 Order Instant with insufficient volume remaining after filled or not matched
103 Order StopMarket with insufficient volume remaining after filled

data.description: The order's SNs and Ids list

id.description: Numeric unique identifier of the trade.

order_id.description: Numeric unique identifier of the order.

market_symbol.description: The market where the trade was created.

side.description: The order book side where the trade was created.

price.description: The price at which the trade was executed.

quantity.description: The quantity execute in this trade.

fee.description: The total in fees paid in this trade.

fee_currency_symbol.description: The currency symbol in which the fees were paid.

created_at.description: The creation date of this trade in ISO-8601 UTC.

timestamp.description: Server time in UNIX Timestamp with milliseconds precision

message.example: The address is being created. Please retry in a few minutes

receiving_address.description: The address of the wallet to which the funds were sent

network_code.description: The identifier of the network on which the transaction was executed

state.description: The current state of the deposit

created_at.description: The creation date of the deposit in ISO-8601 UTC
